title.narrative: Building Capacity Globally on Systematic Reviews
Renforcement des capacités mondiales en matière d'examens systématiques

description.narrative:
Research syntheses are key resources to inform evidence-based decision-making. Syntheses provide guidance from research on how and when a particular policy or intervention is likely to produce a beneficial effect on the health system. The limited involvement of review authors from low- and middle-income countries (LMICs) has been a key challenge, resulting in insufficient reviews that address the needs of LMIC decision-makers.
The Ottawa Hospital Research Institute will support the Cochrane Collaboration in developing an international initiative to build capacity to: - conduct knowledge syntheses in LMICs; - conduct reviews relevant to the needs of clinical, public health, and health system decision-makers in LMICs; - promote the use of syntheses to inform decision-making in LMICs; and, - develop innovative synthesis methods to address the range of questions from clinical, public health, and health system decision-makers in LMICs.
This project will help plan and design this international initiative. Researchers will conduct an environmental scan to more fully understand the needs of LMIC decision-makers for using syntheses and the ability of researchers in these countries to conduct syntheses. The research team will convene a planning meeting of key stakeholders, including LMIC representatives, in Québec City in September 2013.
